name: grafana
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing grafana cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`grafana` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-grafana).

auth.description: API token or basic auth username:password. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_AUTH` environment variable.

caCert.description:
Certificate CA bundle to use to verify the Grafana server's certificate. May alternatively be set via the
`GRAFANA_CA_CERT` environment variable.

insecureSkipVerify.description: Skip TLS certificate verification. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_INSECURE_SKIP_VERIFY` environment variable.

orgId.description:
The organization id to operate on within grafana. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_ORG_ID` environment
variable.

retries.description:
The amount of retries to use for Grafana API calls. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_RETRIES` environment
variable.

smAccessToken.description: A Synthetic Monitoring access token. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_SM_ACCESS_TOKEN` environment variable.

smUrl.description: Synthetic monitoring backend address. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_SM_URL` environment variable.

tlsCert.description:
Client TLS certificate file to use to authenticate to the Grafana server. May alternatively be set via the
`GRAFANA_TLS_CERT` environment variable.

tlsKey.description:
Client TLS key file to use to authenticate to the Grafana server. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_TLS_KEY`
environment variable.

url.description: The root URL of a Grafana server. May alternatively be set via the `GRAFANA_URL` environment variable.

provider.description:
The provider type for the grafana package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

roles.description: Fixed or custom roles which provide granular access for specific resources within Grafana.

dashboardId.description: The numeric ID of the dashboard computed by Grafana.

folder.description: The id of the folder to save the dashboard in.

message.description: Set a commit message for the version history.

overwrite.description:
Set to true if you want to overwrite existing dashboard with newer version, same dashboard title in folder or same
dashboard uid.

slug.description: URL friendly version of the dashboard title. This field is deprecated, please use `uid` instead.

uid.description:
The unique identifier of a dashboard. This is used to construct its URL. Its automatically generated if not provided
when creating a dashboard. The uid allows having consistent URLs for accessing dashboards and when syncing dashboards
between multiple Grafana installs.

version.description:
Whenever you save a version of your dashboard, a copy of that version is saved so that previous versions of your
dashboard are not lost.

folder.description: The id of the folder to save the dashboard in.

Set to true if you want to overwrite existing dashboard with newer version, same dashboard title in folder or same
dashboard uid.

isDefault.description: Whether to set the data source as default. This should only be `true` to a single data source.

name.description: A unique name for the data source.

password.description: (Required by some data source types) The password to use to authenticate to the data source.

type.description: The data source type. Must be one of the supported data source keywords.

adminUser.description:
The login name of the configured default admin user for the Grafana installation. If unset, this value defaults to
admin, the Grafana default. Grafana adds the default admin user to all organizations automatically upon creation, and
this parameter keeps Terraform from removing it from organizations.

admins.description:
A list of email addresses corresponding to users who should be given admin access to the organization. Note: users
specified here must already exist in Grafana unless 'create_users' is set to true.

createUsers.description:
Whether or not to create Grafana users specified in the organization's membership if they don't already exist in
Grafana. If unspecified, this parameter defaults to true, creating placeholder users with the name, login, and email set
to the email of the user, and a random password. Setting this option to false will cause an error to be thrown for any
users that do not already exist in Grafana.

editors.description:
A list of email addresses corresponding to users who should be given editor access to the organization. Note: users
specified here must already exist in Grafana unless 'create_users' is set to true.

name.description: The display name for the Grafana organization created.

orgId.description: The organization id assigned to this organization by Grafana.

viewers.description:
A list of email addresses corresponding to users who should be given viewer access to the organization. Note: users
specified here must already exist in Grafana unless 'create_users' is set to true.

adminUser.description:
The login name of the configured default admin user for the Grafana installation. If unset, this value defaults to
admin, the Grafana default. Grafana adds the default admin user to all organizations automatically upon creation, and
this parameter keeps Terraform from removing it from organizations.

users that do not already exist in Grafana.

alertSensitivity.description:
Can be set to `none`, `low`, `medium`, or `high` to correspond to the check [alert
levels](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/synthetic-monitoring/synthetic-monitoring-alerting/).

basicMetricsOnly.description:
Metrics are reduced by default. Set this to `false` if you'd like to publish all metrics. We maintain a [full list of
metrics](https://github.com/grafana/synthetic-monitoring-agent/tree/main/internal/scraper/testdata) collected for each.

frequency.description:
How often the check runs in milliseconds (the value is not truly a "frequency" but a "period"). The minimum acceptable
value is 1 second (1000 ms), and the maximum is 120 seconds (120000 ms).

labels.description:
Custom labels to be included with collected metrics and logs. The maximum number of labels that can be specified per
check is 5. These are applied, along with the probe-specific labels, to the outgoing metrics. The names and values of
the labels cannot be empty, and the maximum length is 32 bytes.

probes.description: List of probe location IDs where this target will be checked from.

tenantId.description: The tenant ID of the check.

timeout.description:
Specifies the maximum running time for the check in milliseconds. The minimum acceptable value is 1 second (1000 ms),
and the maximum 10 seconds (10000 ms).

alertSensitivity.description:
Can be set to `none`, `low`, `medium`, or `high` to correspond to the check [alert
levels](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/synthetic-monitoring/synthetic-monitoring-alerting/).

basicMetricsOnly.description:
Metrics are reduced by default. Set this to `false` if you'd like to publish all metrics. We maintain a [full list of
metrics](https://github.com/grafana/synthetic-monitoring-agent/tree/main/internal/scraper/testdata) collected for each.

labels.description:

the labels cannot be empty, and the maximum length is 32 bytes.

probes.description: List of probe location IDs where this target will be checked from.

timeout.description:
Specifies the maximum running time for the check in milliseconds. The minimum acceptable value is 1 second (1000 ms),
and the maximum 10 seconds (10000 ms).

levels](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/synthetic-monitoring/synthetic-monitoring-alerting/).

authToken.description: The probe authentication token. Your probe must use this to authenticate with Grafana Cloud.

labels.description: Custom labels to be included with collected metrics and logs.

name.description: Name of the probe.

public.description:
Public probes are run by Grafana Labs and can be used by all users. Only Grafana Labs managed public probes will be set
to `true`.

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing grafana cloud resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-grafana)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi/pulumi-grafana` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-grafana/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-providers/terraform-provider-grafana` repo](https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-grafana/issues).
